results.title: Samba to slow fox
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining documentary about Australian ballroom dancing, from the competition glamour to interviews with the people inside the dancing shoes. This will appeal even to those who don’t know the difference between a samba and a slow fox. Rated: G

results.title: Sam Spiegel in a discussion with Ludovic Kennedy on the producer and the film
results.creator_credit: Hazel Wilkinson and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Sam Spiegel discusses his work as a film producer. Scenes from “Lawrence of Arabia”, “On the Waterfront”, “The African Queen” and “The Bridge on the River Kwai” are shown.

results.title: Sam Maloof: woodworker
results.brief_description: Sam Maloof is a craftsman who designs and builds his own furniture. The film demonstrates the working situation, methods and materials used by him. He talks of his philosophy in working with wood and the satisfaction he finds in his work.

results.title: Salvation
results.creator_credit: Beth B, Michael H. Shanberg and B Movies
results.brief_description: Housewife Rhonda Stample (Exene Cervenka) - married to biker Jerome (Viggo Mortensen), has recently taken to donating her husband’s hard earned wages to Reverend Edward Randall (Stephen McHattie). Randall is a young, good looking, yet sexually repressed pastor on the ministry of the air. Rhonda’s attempts to bring the message of God to to the youth of America, and her new found connection with the Reverend have repercussions for the rest of her family. Her beautiful and promiscuous sister Lenore (Dominique Davalos) sets out to cure the reverend of his repression. She is driven by her brother-in-law, Jerome, a man determined to reap the benefits of the evangelist’s wealth when he resorts to blackmailing the man of cloth. A quirky parody of electronic evangelism set to an energetic soundtrack.

results.title: Salvador Allende Gossens: a testimony
results.creator_credit: Michel Gauthier, Maurice Bulbulian, Jean-Marc Garand and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A brief acquaintance with the president of Chile before his assassination in September, 1973. In 1972, several miners from Quebec went to Chile to observe mining operations there. They also met with the President of the Republic. Salvador Allende explains, publicly at a meeting of icampannerors, as well as in a conference with the visitors, the revolutionary socio-economic reforms he envisages for his country, which include nationalisation of the copper industry. Rene Levesque, Theo Gagne and Joseph Gosselin appear in the film. (A film for all students of political change. With English subtitles)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michel Gauthier, Maurice Bulbulian, Jean-Marc Garand and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Salvador
results.creator_credit: Oliver Stone, Gerald Green and Hemdale Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Seduced by the lure of cheap drink, drugs and sex, an experienced photo- journalist goes with his friend to El Salvador in the early 1980s. Once there they see the turmoil and brutality of the country as it is being destroyed by the conflict, and learn of American involvement. Largely based on the experiences of Richard Boyle, a photo-journalist there in the 1980s. Stars James Woods, James Belushi and Michael Murphy.

results.title: Salty
results.creator_credit: Marion Lee, Sonia Whiteman, Georgina Harper and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Short drama about a fleeting first love between a teenage girl and boy living in an urban beach community. Figuring the couple against an elemental background of eternal sky and sea, the narrative builds on the accumulation of tender moments between them, until the time comes when the boy must leave. Through his fascination with sea salt as a symbol of permanence, the film contrasts the boy’s state of unsettledness with the girl’s solid sense of place. Cast includes Tom Budge and Jacqui Swallow.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Marion Lee, Sonia Whiteman, Georgina Harper and Victorian College of the Arts

results.brief_description: This video looks at the causes of both wetland and dryland salting, its effects and some solutions. No other credits available.
